content.question: Neptunus muros magnoque emota tridenti fundamenta quatit totamque a sedibus urbem eruit. Hic Iuno Scaeas saevissima portas prima tenet sociumque furens a navibus agme 5ferro accincta vocat. Iam summas arces Tritonia, respice, Pallas insedit nimbo effulgens et Gorgone saeva. Ipse pater Danais animos viresque secundas sufficit, ipse deos in Dardana suscitat arma. 10Eripe, nate, fugam finemque impone labori. Aeneid 2. 610-619 Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question. 1. What are the case and use of fundamenta (line 2) ? 2. In lines 1-5 (Neptunus . . . vocat), which three Latin words indicate the thoroughness of the destruction of Troy? 3. (A) Identify one and only one literary device found in line 3 (eruit . . . portas) and (B) write out the Latin word or words that illustrate it. 4. In lines 3-5 (Hic . . . vocat), (A) which two Latin words indicate Juno’s state of mind? (B) Translate them in context. 5. In lines 3-5 (Hic . . . vocat), (A) identify the one Latin word that is an ablative of means and (B) translate it in context. 6. (A) Identify one and only one thing that Minerva does in this passage and (B) write out the specific Latin word or words for the act you identified. 7. Briefly describe the mythological event that turned the goddesses Juno and Minerva against Troy. Answer in 1-2 complete sentences. 8. What are the case and use of Danais (line 8) ? 9. Identify all three imperative verbs in this passage.
